description: An ophthalmology visit consist in a series of test, performed by the ophthalmologist, for the evaluation of health state of the eye and their capability to focus and see object.
more_info:
Since some eyeâ€™s diseases are asymptomatic everyone should have the eyes examined by an ophthalmologist even if any disturb is perceived.
The ophthalmologic examination typically evaluates:
Outward appearance of the eye
Visual acuity
Pupil response to light
Coordination of eye muscles
Interior and back of the eye
Intraocular pressure
Need for eyeglasses or contact lens
The conjunctiva and sclera are instead examined with a penlight or a bio microscopy, gently pulling down the lower lid and asking the patient to look upward and downward. Similar technics are used for the examination of cornea and iris.
